name: Recherche de tendances d'articles Arxiv utilisant l'IA, rédiger un article, envoyer un email
description:
Ce flux de travail rassemble des articles dans Arxiv et une catégorie arxiv spécifique
L'IA aide à créer une forme résumée de la newsletter et à l'envoyer aux abonnés via gmail

## Newsletter sur les tendances des articles Arxiv
### Configuration
- Supabase
  - Schéma de table
    - user_email: Texte - Obligatoire
    - arxiv_cat: [Texte]
    - interested_papers: [Texte]
    - keyword: [Texte]
  - Exemple
{
  "id": 8,
  "created_at": "2024-09-24T12:31:17.09491+00:00",
  "user_email": "test@test.com",
  "arxiv_cat": 
  [
    "cs.AI",
    "cs.LG,cs.AR"
  ],
  "interested_papers": null,
  "keyword": 
  [
    "Architecture IA qui inclut le problème de long contexte"
  ]
}
- Qdrant vector store
  - configuration par défaut

## Configuration pour les sous-flux de travail
- Obtenir la catégorie arxiv par IA pour un mot-clé donné
- Obtenir les catégories arxiv
- Obtenir les articles arxiv de cette semaine et les évaluer par IA
- Filtrer par mot-clé dans les documents donnés
- Extraire les informations sur les articles
- Rédiger la newsletter par IA

nodes.name: Get arxiv papers this week and scoring by AI
Set input for Extract paper information
Set input for Write newsletter by AI

assignments.name: reference_orig
assignments.value: ={{ $('Get arxiv papers this week and scoring by AI').item.json.link }}

nodes.name: Set input for Filter by keyword by RAG
Set input for Get category by AI
Set input for Get arxiv papers this week and scoring by AI

parameters.content:
### Get user subscription info from database
table schema should include
- user_email: text
- arxiv_cat: text[] <- array
  -> you can check category https://arxiv.org/category_taxonomy
- keyword: text[] <- array
- interested_papers: text[] <- array

### example row
{
  "id": 8,
  "created_at": "2024-09-24T12:31:17.09491+00:00",
  "user_email": "test@test.com",
  "arxiv_cat": 
  [
    "cs.AI",
    "cs.LG,cs.AR"
  ],
  "interested_papers": null,
  "keyword": 
  [
    "AI architecture which includes long context problem"
  ]
}

### Get category by AI
- This workflow generate arxiv categories which represents given keyword

### Get subscription info again
- This node is valuable if there is empty category so that it is generated by AI

### Get arxiv papers this week and scoring by AI
- This node retrieve arxiv papers by category in this week
- 3 Filters are applied
  - Filter if arxiv comment exists or if arxiv journal reference exists to retrieve most valuable papers
  - Filter if papers published in this week
  - Filter if prime category matches give categories
- To narrow down number of papers,

### Filter by keyword by RAG
- This node has 3 task
  - Embedding papers into vector stor
  - Query vector store by given keyword
  - And average its score by grouping by its id, then we can get which papers are most matched to keyword

### Extract paper information
- This node extract information from given paper. Actually this is summarization task
- Plus, generate opinion by AI

### Write newsletter by AI
- This node has 2 tasks
  - Translate information into given lang
  - Refine content looks like "newsletter" and applying HTML format

nodes.name: This is used to call following node once

parameters.content:
## Arxive paper trend newsletter
### Setup
- Supabase
  - Table schema
    - user_email: Text - Mandatory
    - arxiv_cat: [Text]
    - interested_papers: [Text]
    - keyword: [Text]
  - Example
{
  "id": 8,
  "created_at": "2024-09-24T12:31:17.09491+00:00",
  "user_email": "test@test.com",
  "arxiv_cat": 
  [
    "cs.AI",
    "cs.LG,cs.AR"
  ],
  "interested_papers": null,
  "keyword": 
  [
    "AI architecture which includes long context problem"
  ]
}
- Qdrant vector store
  - default setup

## Setup for sub workflows
- Get arxiv category by AI for given keyword
- Get arxiv categories
- Get arxiv papers this week and scoring by AI
- Filter by keyword within given documents
- Extract paper information
- Write newsletter by AI

user.name: Jimmy Lee
user.bio: I'm introducing automation using n8n with AI in company

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
